org_name: Group Health Cooperative of South Central Wisconsin

request_pathways.name: Patient Request for Health Information Form
Authorization to Release Protected Health Information From GHC-SCW
In-person drop-off at clinic or ROI office

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Dedicated one-page fillable PDF form ('Patient Request for Health Information Form') specifically designed for patients requesting their own records, separate from the general third-party authorization form.

red_flags: Form 2 lacks submission instructions — no mailing address, fax number, or email on the form itself
Fee disclosure is vague ('there may be charges') with no amounts specified; CIOX Health involvement may introduce fees beyond HIPAA cost-based limits
bright_spots: Dedicated patient self-access form separate from third-party authorization — a genuine best practice
Fully fillable PDF with 49 interactive fields on a single concise page
Encrypted email delivery as default with opt-in for unencrypted — privacy by design
Multiple delivery formats including MyChart portal, email, CD, USB, and paper
Plain-English question-based section headers make the form approachable
Explicit HIPAA right of access statement

findability.rationale: Level 5: Forms were prominently available with minimal effort — first web search returned the direct PDF URL, and the forms page is well-organized with a dedicated ROI section. No barriers encountered.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — Form 2 is fully fillable (49 interactive fields) allowing on-screen completion, but submission requires fax, email, or mail rather than an integrated online portal.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized single-page form with plain-language question headers and logical flow, but lacks submission instructions on the form itself — a notable gap that prevents a patient from completing the process without consulting other sources.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Process is designed around patient self-access as a first-class use case — a dedicated patient access form clearly distinct from third-party release, with multiple delivery options including MyChart, encrypted email, and explicit HIPAA right-of-access language.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, no in-person requirement, explicit rights statement, and transparent 5-day timeline; minor ambiguity around fee disclosure ('there may be charges' without specifying amounts) and CIOX involvement, but nothing that would materially impede a patient.

overall.summary: GHC-SCW demonstrates strong patient-centeredness with a dedicated, fillable patient access form and multiple delivery options, earning a high B; the main gaps are vague fee disclosure and missing submission instructions on the patient form.
